definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Your job is to do your job, not to be a pushover.
sentences.chinese: 工作就是工作，别做一只任人捏的软柿子。

sentences.english: Government should take it hard with the Ukrainian part.
sentences.chinese: 印度政府不闻不问的，印度人成为了软柿子。

definition: sb who is easy to deal with
to leak (of air)/to go flat (of a tire)/to vent one's anger
strong in appearance but weak in reality (idiom)
(metaphorical) punching bag/undeserving target of sb's wrath
not to be trifled with/not to be pushed around/stand no nonsense
to admit defeat/to give in/to acknowledge a mistake/to apologize/to be amenable to persuasion
display of severity immediately on taking office/(fig.) initial show of strength
to meet with unexpected failure (idiom)/to fail miserably (where failure was not expected)
susceptible to force but not persuasion
to be looking for one's teeth all over the floor/(fig.) to get beaten up badly/to beat the crap out of (sb)
